newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares seen rangebound, buyers sidelined.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares seen rangebound, buyers sidelined.

text.p: Singapore shares were seen rangebound on Tuesday with investors remaining sidelined in the absence of positive factors to lift the market, dealers said.
"There's not much out there to move the market," one dealer at a Singapore brokerage said.
On Monday the Straits Times Industrials Index closed slightly weaker, down 4.58 points to 2,060.90
Those eyeing Wall Street for inspiration were disappointed by an overnight correction, while Hong Kong was making ground in attracting foreign investment in Asia at the moment, another dealer said.
Some window dressing of bank and property stocks on Monday was not thought likely to result in buy orders either.
"The sellers are stacking up out there," the dealer said.
